title: sepcomp-lib-lto test fails with multiple codegen units
body:
I'm not sure whether this is a bug or not. I built rust with multiple codegen units in the hopes of faster compile times:

```
RUSTFLAGS="-C codegen-units=4" make -j4 check-stage1-rpass
```

and the test failed

```
failures:

---- [run-pass] run-pass/sepcomp-lib-lto.rs stdout ----

error: compilation failed!
status: exit code: 101
command: x86_64-apple-darwin/stage1/bin/rustc /Users/alex/Programming/rust/rust/src/test/run-pass/sepcomp-lib-lto.rs -L x86_64-apple-darwin/test/run-pass/ --target=x86_64-apple-darwin -L x86_64-apple-darwin/test/run-pass/sepcomp-lib-lto.stage1-x86_64-apple-darwin.run-pass.libaux -o x86_64-apple-darwin/test/run-pass/sepcomp-lib-lto.stage1-x86_64-apple-darwin -C codegen-units=4 --cfg rtopt -O -L x86_64-apple-darwin/rt -C lto
stdout:
------------------------------------------

------------------------------------------
stderr:
------------------------------------------
error: can't perform LTO when using multiple codegen units

------------------------------------------

thread '[run-pass] run-pass/sepcomp-lib-lto.rs' panicked at 'explicit panic', /Users/alex/Programming/rust/rust/src/compiletest/runtest.rs:1505
```

I'm sure this build configuration is unsupported so as I said maybe this isn't a bug. But maybe this test should be conditionally ignored, somehow.
